title: Categorization of a Point in a Scatterplot
question_text:
Created for Albert.io. Copyright 2017. All rights reserved.

The scatterplot above shows age and shoe-size data that researchers collected on a random sample of students in a middle school.
How would the point ($19, 14$) be categorized?

choices.text: The point is an outlier but will not change the correlation.
The point is an outlier that is influential in changing the correlation.
The point is high-leverage but not an outlier.
The point is neither an outlier nor high-leverage.

solution:
An outlier is any point that does not follow the general trend and that has a high residual. While the point (
19
,
14
) is far away from the rest of the other data, it is still along the general trend.

A high leverage point greatly affects either the slope and/or the correlation because it has a substantially larger or smaller
x
-value than the other observations. While the point may lie similarly on the linear regression line and would not affect the slope, it does fit the latter part of the definition of affecting the correlation.

This point would greatly increase the correlation coefficient, which indicates the strength of a linear trend, by a significant amount.

The point
(
19
,
14
)
fits the definition of a high leverage point.

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'C'.
